tasks.comments:
The Format String exploit, or uncontrolled format string, is a type of code injection vulnerability where user supplied input is evaluated as a command. Format functions such as fprint, printf, sprintf, snprintf, etc. can make the application vulnerable if they are used with certain parameters.

For example, using printf with %x.%x. as (user) input, will print off 2 stack values, which could leak sensitive data.
